vulnerability_findings.name: use-abi-encodecall-instead-of-encodewithselector
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: (bool success, bytes memory data) = token.call(abi.encodeWithSelector(0x095ea7b3, to, value));
vulnerability_findings.message: To guarantee arguments type safety it is recommended to use `abi.encodeCall` instead of `abi.encodeWithSelector`.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-abi-encodecall-instead-of-encodewithselector
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: (bool success, bytes memory data) = token.call(abi.encodeWithSelector(0xa9059cbb, to, value));
vulnerability_findings.message: To guarantee arguments type safety it is recommended to use `abi.encodeCall` instead of `abi.encodeWithSelector`.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-abi-encodecall-instead-of-encodewithselector
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: (bool success, bytes memory data) = token.call(abi.encodeWithSelector(0x23b872dd, from, to, value));
vulnerability_findings.message: To guarantee arguments type safety it is recommended to use `abi.encodeCall` instead of `abi.encodeWithSelector`.

vulnerability_findings.name: array-length-outside-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Caching the array length outside a loop saves reading it on each iteration, as long as the array's length is not changed during the loop.

vulnerability_findings.name: non-optimal-variables-swap
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider swapping variables using `(reversedPath[i], reversedPath[reversedPath.length - i - 1]) = (reversedPath[reversedPath.length - i - 1], reversedPath[i])` to save gas

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(initializing || isConstructor() || !initialized, "Contract instance has already been initialized");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-multiple-require
